plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: A tall, annual plant known for its large, bright yellow flower heads that follow the sun's movement throughout the day. Widely cultivated and also found growing wild in fields.
plants.funFact: Sunflowers exhibit heliotropism when young, turning their flower heads to face the sun during the day.

plants.name: Rudbeckia hirta
plants.description: A hardy perennial commonly found in meadows and gardens with daisy-like flowers featuring vibrant golden-yellow petals and dark brown central cones.
plants.funFact: Black-eyed Susans are popular with butterflies and birds, which feed on their nectar and seeds.

plants.name: Erythrina crista-galli
plants.description: A striking flowering tree or shrub with bright red, spiny flowers that resemble a rooster's comb, blooming profusely in late summer and early fall.
plants.location: South America, especially Argentina and Uruguay
plants.funFact: This tree is the national flower of Argentina and Uruguay.

plants.name: Dahlias (genus Dahlia)
plants.description: Tubers producing a variety of flower shapes and vivid colors, popular in gardens worldwide. Blooms peak late summer through fall.
plants.location: Native to Mexico and Central America, widely cultivated globally
plants.funFact: Dahlias are the national flower of Mexico and come in over 42 species and thousands of cultivars.
